equations.name: Area of a circle
equations.description: Where \(A\) is the area and \(r\) is the radius

equations.name: Area of a trapezium
equations.description: Where \(a, b\) are the length of the parallel sides and \(h\) is the perpendicular height

equations.name: Circumference of a circle
equations.description: Where \(p\) is the perimeter, \(r\) is the radius and \(d\) is the diameter

equations.name: Volume of a sphere
equations.description: Where \(V\) is the volume and \(r\) is the radius

equations.name: Surface Area of a sphere
equations.description: Where \(A\) is the area and \(r\) is the radius

equations.name: Volume of a pyramid
equations.description: Where \(V\) is the volume.

equations.name: Volume of a cone
equations.description: Where \(V\) is the volume, \(h\) is the height, and \(r\) is the radius of the base.

equations.name: Curved surface area of a cone
equations.description: Where \(A\) is the area, \(r\) is the radius and \(l\) is the slant height

equations.name: Pythagoras
equations.description: Where \(c\) is the length of the hypotenuse, and \(a, b, \dots,n\) are the adjacent sides.

equations.name: Sine, Cosine, Tangent
equations.description: Where \(H\) is the hypotenuse, \(A\) is the adjacent side to, and \(O\) is the opposite side to the angle \(\theta\)

equations.name: Inverse Sine, Cosine, Tangent
equations.description: Where \(\theta\) is the subject angle. In other words, the inverse of a function does the reverse of the original.

equations.name: Sine rule
equations.description: For any triangle of sides \(a, b, c\) and angles \(A, B, C\)

equations.name: Area of a triangle
equations.description: For any triangle of base \(b\) and height \(h\), or of sides \(a, b, c\) and angles \(A, B, C\)

equations.name: Cosine rule
equations.description: For any triangle of sides \(a, b, c\) and angles \(A, B, C\)

equations.name: The product of values of a common base is the base to the sum of the values
The nth root is the inverse power
Anything to the zero is one
Powers of powers are equal to the product of the powers
Volume of a frustum
equations.latex: V=\text{volume of larger pyramid}-\text{volume of smaller pyramid}
equations.description: Where \(V\) is the volume

equations.name: Completing the square
equations.description: Where the second term in the brackets is the negative of the \(x\) of the turning point, and the constant term on the end is the \(y\)

equations.name: Quadratic formula
equations.description: Where the quadratic is of the form \(ax^2+bx+c\)

equations.name: Binomial Expansion
equations.description: Where \({n \choose k}\), is the binomial coeffient, obtainable on a calculator through the \(\bold{c}\) button. In generalised form, this equation becomes, $$(a+b)^n=\sum^{n}_{k=0}\binom{n}{k}a^{n-k}b^k$$

equations.name: Derivative of a polynomial
equations.description: Using the definition of a derivative and the binomial expansion

equations.name: Indefinite integral
equations.description: The integral of a function is also known as the antiderivative, and must end with \(+c\)

equations.name: Definite integral
equations.description: Gives the area under the curve \(f'(x)\)

equations.name: Volume of a cylinder
equations.description: Where \(V\) is the volume, \(r\) is the radius of the base and \(h\) is the height.

equations.name: Speed, distance, time
equations.description: Where \(v\) is the velocity, \(s\) is the displacement and \(\Delta t\) is the time.

equations.name: Compount interest
equations.description: Where after after \(y\) years (months, or iterations), with a start value \(s\) and an interest rate \(i\), the total is \(\text{total}\)

equations.name: Or in probability
equations.description: Where \(P(X)\) is the probability of \(X\) occuring

equations.name: And in probability
equations.description: Where \(P(X)\) is the probability of \(X\) occuring

equations.name: Suvat 1
equations.description: Where \(v\) is the velocity at \(t\), \(u\) is the velocity at \(t=0\), \(a\) is the constant acceleration and \(t\) is the time.

equations.name: Suvat 2
equations.description: Where \(v\) is the velocity at \(t\), \(u\) is the velocity at \(t=0\), \(a\) is the constant acceleration, \(s\) is the displacement and \(t\) is the time.

equations.name: Suvat 3
equations.description: Where \(u\) is the velocity at \(t=0\), \(a\) is the constant acceleration, \(s\) is the displacement, and \(t\) is the time.

equations.name: Suvat 4
equations.description: Where \(v\) is the velocity at \(t\), \(a\) is the constant acceleration, \(s\) is the displacement and \(t\) is the time.

equations.name: Suvat 5
equations.description: Where \(v\) is the velocity at \(t\), \(u\) is the velocity at \(t=0\), \(s\) is the displacement and \(t\) is the time.

equations.name: Velocity against displacement
equations.latex: v(t)=x'(t)\therefore x(t)=\int_0^t v(a)\mathrm da \therefore x=\int v(t)\mathrm dt
equations.description: Where \(v(t)\) is the velocity at time \(t\), and \(x(t)\) is the displacement at time \(t\)

equations.name: Velocity against acceleration
equations.latex: a(t)=v'(t)\therefore v(t)=\int_0^t a(x)\mathrm dx \therefore v=\int a(t)\mathrm dt
equations.description: Where \(v(t)\) is the velocity at time \(t\), and \(a(t)\) is the acceleration at time \(t\)

equations.name: Gradient of a straight line
equations.description: Where \(y=mx+c\)

equations.name: Area of a sector
equations.description: Where \(A\) is the area, \(\theta\) is the sector angle and \(r\) is the radius

equations.name: Perimeter of a sector
equations.description: Where \(p\) is the perimeter, \(\theta\) is the sector angle and \(r\) is the radius

equations.name: Sum of interior angles
equations.description: Where \(n\) is the number of sides of the shape

equations.name: Exterior angle in a regular polygon
equations.description: Where \(n\) is the number of sides of the polygon

equations.name: Direct proportion
equations.description: Where \(k\) is a constant

equations.name: Inverse proportion
equations.description: Where \(k\) is a constant

equations.name: Perpendicular gradient
equations.description: Where \(y=mx+c\)

equations.name: Density, mass, volume
equations.description: Where \(\rho\) is the density, \(m\) is the mass and \(V\) is the volume.

equations.name: Kinetic Energy
equations.description: Where \(E_k\) is the kinetic energy of a body mass \(m\) and speed \(v\)

equations.name: Gravitational Potential Energy
equations.description: Where \(E_p\) is the change in gravitational potential energy for a body of mass \(m\) in a gravitational field of strength \(g\) over a height \(h\)

equations.name: Power
equations.description: Where \(P\) is the power, \(W\) is the word done, \(t\) is the time elapsed and \(E\) is the energy

equations.name: Elastic potential energy
equations.description: Where \(E_e\) is the elastic potential energy, \(k\) is the spring constant and \(x\) is the spring extension

equations.name: Thermal Energy Change
equations.description: Where \(\Delta E\) is the change in thermal energy of a mass \(m\), with a specific heat capacity \(c\) and temperature change of \(\Delta\theta\)

equations.name: Charge Flow
equations.description: Where \(Q\) is the charge, \(I\) is the current and \(t\) is the time elapsed

equations.name: Potential difference
equations.description: Where \(V\) is the potential difference (voltage), \(I\) is the current and \(R\) is the resistance

equations.name: Potential difference
equations.description: Where \(V\) is the potential difference (voltage), \(I\) is the current and \(R\) is the resistance

equations.name: Total Resistance
equations.description: Where \(R_x\) is the resistance of the xth branch and \(R_t\) is the total resistance

equations.name: Electrical Power
equations.description: Where \(V\) is the potential difference (voltage), \(I\) is the current and \(P\) is the power

equations.name: Power 2
equations.description: Where \(R\) is the resistance, \(I\) is the current and \(P\) is the power

equations.name: Energy Flow
equations.description: Where \(E\) is the used energy, \(Q\) is the charge and \(V\) is the voltage.

equations.name: Thermal energy for state change
equations.description: Where \(m\) is the mass of a body with specific latent heat \(L\)

equations.name: Gas pressure and volume
equations.description: Where \(p\) is the pressure and \(V\) is the volume

equations.name: Weight
equations.description: Where \(W\) is the weight of a body of mass \(m\) in a gravitational field of strength \(g\)

equations.name: Work done
equations.description: Where \(F\) is a force exerted over a distance \(s\)

equations.name: Spring force
equations.description: Where \(F\) is a force exerted by a spring of extension \(x\) and spring constant \(k\)

equations.name: Moment of force
equations.description: Where \(M\) is the moment for a force \(F\) over a distance \(s\), perpendicular to the direction of the force

equations.name: Pressure
equations.description: Where \(p\) is the pressure exerted by a (perpendicular) force \(F\) over an area \(A\)

equations.name: Acceleration
equations.description: Where \(a\) is the acceleration of a particle who's velocity changed by \(\Delta v\) in a time \(t\)

equations.name: Newton's second law of motion
equations.description: Where \(F\) is the force exrted by a particle of mass \(m\), of velocity \(v\) and an acceleration \(a\). For those with knowledge of calculus, this is generalised to, $$F=\frac{\mathrm d(mv)}{\mathrm dt}$$

equations.name: Momentum
equations.description: Where \(p\) is the momentum of a particle of mass \(m\) moving at a velocity \(v\)

equations.name: Pressure in a liquid
equations.description: Where \(p\) is the pressure at the height \(h\) in an incompressible liquid of density \(\rho\) in a gravitational field of strength \(g\)

equations.name: Wave speed
equations.description: Where \(v\) is the speed of a wave with frequency \(f\) and wavelength \(\lambda\)

equations.name: Force in a magnetic field
equations.description: Where \(F\) is the forced exerted by a magnetic field of strength \(B\) on a conductor of current \(I\) with a length \(l\) in the magnetic field

equations.name: Coils and potential difference in electromagnetism
equations.description: Where \(V_n, N_n\) denote the potential difference across, and turns in coil \(n\) respectively

equations.name: Current and potential different across coils
equations.description: Where \(V_n, I_n\) denote the potential difference across, and current in coil \(n\) respectively
